name: Elodin
headline: Unified flight software and hardware for the mission of tomorrow
description: Elodin creates flight software, simulations, and hardware for drones, satellites, and defense.
tags: industry:hard-tech; industry:drones; industry:satellites; industry:rocketry; industry:aerospace; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Daniel Driscoll, Founder
founders.description: A technology adventurer experienced in tanks (and armored warfare in general), video games (playing and making them), sales/marketing & CRM/LMS/digital content platforms, real estate investment platforms, SaaS API platforms generally, blockchain technology (both core technology and services), and aerospace technology (specifically rocketry, guidance and control systems)

founders.name: Tom Gurka, Founder
founders.description: Kicked my career off working for design agencies in San Francisco.  Eventually shifted to the startup game - helping build multiple companies from the ground floor. Zuli, Token, M10 and Spatial.

founders.name: Akhil Velagapudi, Founder
founders.description: Grew up in New Jersey, and studied electrical + computer engineering at Rutgers. I entered the startup world with M10, where I worked on distributed systems and developed a passion for systems engineering. After M10, I went to Google to work on kubernetes networking, focusing of programmable data planes. I tend to spend my free time either reading fantasy/sci-fi or working on my homelab (which keeps growing).

founders.name: Sascha Wise, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Elodin Systems, developers of simulation tools for aerospace. I'm a software engineer by practice and a physicist by training. I've worked on a wide variety of projects throughout my career from a database for central banks to the flight software for a deep space mission. I'm passionate about building simple, elegant solutions to complex problems. In my spare time, I try and get outdoors as much as possible, which usually means climbing or skiing.

what we do
# Elodin is the platform for building, testing, and deploying autonomous systems. Our aerospace-grade hardware and software power AI-driven flight.
example use cases
Drones

the elodin system
# Get your project designed, tested and in the air fast.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e765b0c3d8dbbd890_Rectangle%20729.svg)
simulation
Create, simulate, and test complex alogorithms.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e344c61b99cb3ec2f_Rectangle%20729-1.svg)
Flight Computer
Open development platform to run customizable flight software.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e030b46153b7c174c_Rectangle%20729-2.svg)
Flight Software
Seamlessly run SITL and HITL tests against existing flight hardware.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/67a260a3d7fb7c4358cac07e_triangle%20of%20power.svg)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e765b0c3d8dbbd890_Rectangle%20729.svg)
simulation
### Create, simulate, and test complex algorithms
A simulation platform built to connect your flight software and hardware. Use our expressive API to describe your physics simulations – no matter how advance the physics.
[watch video demos](https://elodin.systems/</video-demos>)
### simulate fleets of drones & satellites
Coordinate, test, and refine complex swarm behaviors in real-time. Elodin enables rapid simulations of tens of thousands of autonomous actors.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6727ace5a33d0c93b004add0_phys.png)
### define your own math
Complete control and customization of underlying algorithms.
[read documentation![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726f0323fb6aa509a8f43b7_icon_18_external_link.png)](https://elodin.systems/<https:/docs.elodin.systems/get-started/quickstart/>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726f5a1a74f2475a7a5b1be_monte_carlo_extra.png)
### evaluate and test mission profiles
Run 100,000s of simultaneous Monte Carlo simulations right from the comfort of your laptop.
[Download now](https://elodin.systems/<https:/docs.elodin.systems>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e344c61b99cb3ec2f_Rectangle%20729-1.svg)
flight computer
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726d5a5da54fc946de2ecb0_aleph_center_bento.png)
### the aleph flight computer
Designed from inception to be powerful, open-source, and easily modifiable, Aleph unlocks the next generation of autonomous platforms.
[view product details](https://elodin.systems/</products/aleph>)
### open modular Architecture
Aleph is designed to be highly modular, supporting a range of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) components, enabling quick updates, repairs, and seamless upgrades.
[download datasheet pdf![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726f192824130b80ea57cd7_icon_18_external_link_pumpkin.png)](https://elodin.systems/<https:/cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/67367569ea77ac810c34ba48_Elodin_Aleph_FlightComputer.pdf>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726c7c61fce55e1b08a7ae3_nvidia.png)
### ai capable
Unleash the full potential of the NVIDIA Jetson Orin SOM, providing high-performance edge computing for real-time AI tasks. This enables advanced machine learning models for autonomous flight and decision-making.
[view NVIDIA jetson orin![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6726f192824130b80ea57cd7_icon_18_external_link_pumpkin.png)](https://elodin.systems/<https:/www.nvidia.com/en-us/autonomous-machines/embedded-systems/jetson-orin/>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6723b70e030b46153b7c174c_Rectangle%20729-2.svg)
flight software
### Plug and play flight software
Out of the box, ready to rock. Elodin flight software is ready to fly from the minute you install it, in any condition.
[checkout github](https://elodin.systems/<https:/github.com/elodin-sys/elodin>)
### Satellite aDCS
Achieve precise attitude control for satellite missions with our integrated ADCS. Built to work with a wide range of sensors and actuators. Check ADCS off the list of things you need to build.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65b83ac4cf86c236d2b91487/6731cc007ddd3e6e498d2782_graph.svg)
### Live telemetry
Monitor real-time data with our live telemetry feature, providing instant insights and diagnostics to keep your mission on track and respond swiftly to changing conditions.

[![blog image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65badeacc94ad9eb3ec9c27e/674e0cad740516bbdfe52b70_Slide%2016_9%20-%2013_v2.png)](https://elodin.systems/</post/a-better-approach-to-gravity-how-we-made-egm2008-faster>)[Innovation & Discovery](https://elodin.systems/</post/a-better-approach-to-gravity-how-we-made-egm2008-faster>)### [A better approach to gravity - how we made EGM2008 faster](https://elodin.systems/</post/a-better-approach-to-gravity-how-we-made-egm2008-faster>)
We've added a new feature to Elodin: an ultra-high-speed implementation of EGM2008, a high precision model of Earth's gravitational field.
[![blog image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65badeacc94ad9eb3ec9c27e/671695a4f91f2b6212c5f0b7_funding.png)](https://elodin.systems/</post/closing-of-our-pre-seed-round>)[Updates](https://elodin.systems/</post/closing-of-our-pre-seed-round>)### [Closing of our $2M pre-seed round](https://elodin.systems/</post/closing-of-our-pre-seed-round>)
We're happy to be supported by Y Combinator, Soma Capital, Karman Ventures, Kulveer Taggar, Leonis Investissement, and others

## Frequently Asked Questions
Find answers to common questions about our platform, its uses, and technical requirements.
[Join our Discord](https://elodin.systems/<https:/elodin.app/discord>)
What is Elodin?
Elodin is a cutting-edge aerospace simulation platform that enables engineers to design, test, and simulate control systems for drones, satellites, and aerospace robotics.
How does Elodin work?
Elodin provides a Rust and Python physics simulation toolkit that utilizes XLA and JAX. We allow you to easily create custom physics simulations, all running on the GPU. We also include a suite of simulations and algorithms to make building your simulation turn-key. Once you've built out your simulation, you can leverage our cloud platform to run massive numbers of tests in the cloud.
What industries can benefit from using Elodin?
Elodin is ideal for aerospace companies, research institutions, robotics developers, and educational institutions seeking to innovate and accelerate their aerospace projects. Elodin is also useful for anyone else who needs a fast, GPU-accelerated simulation pipeline. If you have a different use case, feel free to reach out to us, and we can work on how you can use Elodin.
What programming languages or skills are required to use Elodin?
Elodin currently allows you to write physics simulations in Rust or Python. The software you are testing with our simulations can be written in any language you want. We plan on adding support for more languages in the future, if you have a specific language request please reach out.
Can I integrate Elodin with my existing workflow or tools?
Yes, Elodin is designed to integrate seamlessly with existing workflows and tools. Our goal is to allow incremental adoption of Elodin, use us for any piece of your simulation stack no matter how big or small.
How secure is Elodin’s platform?
Security is a top priority for Elodin. We employ industry-standard security measures, including encryption, access controls, and regular security audits, to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of user data.
Is Elodin suitable for beginners in aerospace engineering?
Yes, Elodin is designed to be user-friendly and accessible to engineers of all skill levels. Beginners can use Elodin’s intuitive interface and extensive documentation to get started with ease.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Find answers to common questions about our platform, its uses, and technical requirements.
Join our Discord⟨18⟩
What is Elodin?
Elodin is a cutting-edge aerospace simulation platform that enables engineers to design, test, and simulate control systems for drones, satellites, and aerospace robotics.
How does Elodin work?
Elodin provides a Rust and Python physics simulation toolkit that utilizes XLA and JAX. We allow you to easily create custom physics simulations, all running on the GPU. We also include a suite of simulations and algorithms to make building your simulation turn-key. Once you've built out your simulation, you can leverage our cloud platform to run massive numbers of tests in the cloud.
What industries can benefit from using Elodin?
Elodin is ideal for aerospace companies, research institutions, robotics developers, and educational institutions seeking to innovate and accelerate their aerospace projects. Elodin is also useful for anyone else who needs a fast, GPU-accelerated simulation pipeline. If you have a different use case, feel free to reach out to us, and we can work on how you can use Elodin.
What programming languages or skills are required to use Elodin?
Elodin currently allows you to write physics simulations in Rust or Python. The software you are testing with our simulations can be written in any language you want. We plan on adding support for more languages in the future, if you have a specific language request please reach out.
Can I integrate Elodin with my existing workflow or tools?
Yes, Elodin is designed to integrate seamlessly with existing workflows and tools. Our goal is to allow incremental adoption of Elodin, use us for any piece of your simulation stack no matter how big or small.
How secure is Elodin’s platform?
Security is a top priority for Elodin. We employ industry-standard security measures, including encryption, access controls, and regular security audits, to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of user data.
Is Elodin suitable for beginners in aerospace engineering?
Yes, Elodin is designed to be user-friendly and accessible to engineers of all skill levels. Beginners can use Elodin’s intuitive interface and extensive documentation to get started with ease.

generated_description:
### Elodin: Shaping the Future of Autonomous Flight

**Overview**  
Elodin is a dynamic startup based in San Francisco, founded in 2023, which specializes in creating cutting-edge flight software, simulations, and hardware for drones, satellites, and defense applications. This company is part of Y Combinator's W24 batch, which not only brings a level of prestige but also a supportive network for early-stage companies. Their mission? "Unified flight software and hardware for the mission of tomorrow." 

**Team & Management**  
The company operates with a lean team of five talented individuals, highlighted by the involvement of Gustaf Alstromer as their Group Partner. This small but passionate crew is focused on building robust solutions that can operate under various conditions—essentially, they’re gearing up to tackle the most demanding aerospace challenges yet.

**What They Do**  
At its core, Elodin is developing a platform for building, testing, and deploying autonomous systems. Their offerings include:

- **Autonomous Flight Solutions**: This includes software and hardware tailored for drones and satellites. They're keen on applications ranging from robust drone control to non-standard airframes and even cargo delivery in extreme weather conditions.
- **Aleph Flight Computer**: A powerful, open-source flight computer designed for easy modular upgrades and integration with existing systems.
- **Simulation Tools**: Elodin’s simulation platform allows users to create, simulate, and test complex algorithms and observe how fleets of drones or satellites behave under various conditions, leveraging cloud computing for scalability.

**Technology Stack**  
Elodin’s technology utilizes Rust and Python for physics simulation, and it efficiently runs tests leveraging GPUs. This results in a highly adaptable environment that supports various workflows and is suited for both large enterprises and individual innovators.

**Current Endeavors**  
Elodin is focused on enhancing functionality and user experience. They recently closed a pre-seed funding round of $2 million, supported by prominent investors like Y Combinator and Soma Capital. Their development road map includes enhancing the simulation framework, adding more integrations, and expanding the capabilities of the Aleph flight computer.

**Industry Impact & Use Cases**  
Targeting industries such as aerospace, defense, robotics, and education, Elodin's technology is built to spark innovation and accelerate project development, paving the way for significant advancements in autonomous flight. 

**Conclusion**  
In essence, Elodin is not merely a tech startup; it’s a forward-thinking organization poised to transform the world of autonomous systems. With a clear mission, a fusion of talented people, and robust technology, they are on a journey to shape the future of flight, and it’s one worth watching closely. 

For more information, you can explore their offerings at [Elodin Systems](https://elodin.systems/).
